intro: Sarcostemma tetrapterum, commonly known as the four-winged milkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains latex, which is a common feature in the milkweed family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils or in dry woodlands. Sarcostemma tetrapterum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
